etymology.description: 工(工) (gōng, "work; craft") + 作(作) (zuò, "do; make") = activity of working or doing tasks, hence "work"
etymology.interpretation: The combination of 工(工) (gōng, "work; craft") and 作(作) (zuò, "do; make") signifies the activity of performing tasks or duties, reflecting the idea of engaging in labor or a job. This word is a straightforward depiction of performing tasks, thus representing the concept of work.

examples.chinese: 我在公司工作(我在公司工作)。
他每天工作八小时(他每天工作八小時)，然后按时回家(然後按時回家)。
examples.pinyin: Tā měitiān gōngzuò bā xiǎoshí, ránhòu ànshí huíjiā.
examples.english: He works eight hours every day, then goes home on time.

examples.chinese: 尽管工作艰辛(儘管工作艱辛)，他依然满怀希望(他依然滿懷希望)。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnguǎn gōngzuò jiānxīn, tā yīrán mǎn huái xīwàng.
examples.english: Although work is tough, he remains full of hope.
